meanings.definition: Tending to make obscure or unclear.
meanings.sent1: The obfuscatory language in the contract confused many people.
meanings.sent2: The professor's obfuscatory explanation left the students puzzled.
meanings.sent3: The magician's obfuscatory trick made the audience scratch their heads.
meanings.sent4: The obfuscatory fog enveloped the town, hiding everything from view.
meanings.sent5: The obfuscatory puzzle was so challenging that no one could solve it.

meanings.sent1: The obfuscatory instructions on the map led us in circles.
meanings.sent2: The obfuscatory riddle stumped even the cleverest detective.
meanings.sent3: The obfuscatory prank caused laughter once the confusion cleared.
meanings.sent4: The obfuscatory maze of mirrors disoriented the visitors.
meanings.sent5: The obfuscatory plot twist in the movie caught everyone by surprise.

meanings.definition: Characterized by being difficult to understand.
meanings.sent1: The obfuscatory manual made assembling the furniture a challenge.
meanings.sent2: The obfuscatory concept required hours of study to grasp.
meanings.sent3: The obfuscatory jargon in the report made it hard to follow.
meanings.sent4: The obfuscatory path through the forest confused the hikers.
meanings.sent5: The obfuscatory theory was beyond the comprehension of most students.
